Text: good quality good sound shitty movie lol

this is not a shitty movie, @mrdopeman.  in fact, it's one of the best ever within the genre, in my most humble of fanatic scream series fan (who, though agoraphobic,  went to the 00:01 thursday showing on secret imax) opinions.

when one criticizes something, one should explain their criticism unless it is uncommonly & obviously obvious & commonly understood as such excepting the oblivious.

so i'll ask that you either recommend to me some other films within the meta-referencing comedy-disguised-as-horror slasher genre that will educate me to your ostensibly superior level, @mrdopeman.  & if you do this for me -- for US -- i will be authentically appreciative, in that way that the stock of a successful public corporation appreciates.  if you simply just don't like, or don't understand, the genre, then i'd love to know which genre(& which films in particular within) that you prefer.  in any other case, i'll ask you to explain your deconstructive criticism of this masterfully-done work in a constructive manner, if you would be so f'king kind.

& thank you so much, @hiest, for the upload & for the sample pngs.

sincerely ariel,
arielmercoledi@meerkat.cc

long live black comedy grindhouse & slasher horror!
Agree with you ariel! I really enjoyed this one!

Oh Ariel, I'd say you need to calm down and just accept opinions as simply subjectivity. Not everybody has the time to deconstruct the previously deconstructed (I say this with the utmost self-awareness). Personally, I've gotten very tired of the pseudo-post-post-modern horror stuff and I couldn't help but feel that the movie came out 8 years too late (online streaming deaths, "unexpected as the new clichĂÂ¨", etc.) Scream was like the Reeces of horror brain candy. This fourth installment was like receiving Necco wafers on Halloween; the sentiment is there but the substance is a relic of a different time.
